description: {"blocks":[{"key":"ae95a","text":"Animal models that accurately recapitulate the accumulation of alpha-synuclein (α-syn) inclusions, progressive neurodegeneration of the nigrostriatal system and motor deficits can be useful tools for Parkinson's disease (PD) research. The preformed fibril (PFF) synucleinopathy model in rodents generally displays these PD-relevant features, however, the magnitude and predictability of these events is far from established. We therefore have optimized the sonication protocol of α-syn fibrils to ensure reliable, robust results. This protocol includes steps for sonication of PFFs on the day of injection into mice.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
disclaimer: {"blocks":[{"key":"arg1o","text":"The protocols.io team notes that research involving animals and humans must be conducted according to internationally-accepted standards and should always have prior approval from an Institutional Ethics Committee or Board.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":4,"length":12}],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"link","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"D0F6C2A82C8D11EF83D90A58A9FEAC02","url":"http://protocols.io"}}}}

fork_info.title: Generation and Sonication of α-synuclein Fibrils

in vivo mouse models in which α-synuclein is endogenously expressed, we use PFFs generated from recombinant mouse α-synuclein because human α-synuclein is not as efficient in seeding α-synuclein inclusions from endogenously expressed mouse α-synuclein.","type":"unstyled"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"18hrd","text":"","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

status.info: We use this protocol and it's working

steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"612mf","text":"After the temperature inside Q700 Sonicator water reservoir is equilibrated to  , thaw and pipette   PFFs stored at   and transfer to polystyrene sonication tube (Active Motif, Cat No. 53071) inside a biosafety cabinet. Screw the cap of the polystyrene sonication tube tightly after transferring, but avoid overtightening. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":79,"length":1},{"key":1,"offset":99,"length":1},{"key":2,"offset":116,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"b9cdh","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"e7c90","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":3,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"441ql","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"temperature","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"error_temperature":false,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"temperature":"10","unit":10}},"1":{"type":"amount","mutability":"","data":{"amount":"25-22","error":false,"guid":"F7F63C80AF2211EAA85E013497DF7FCF","id":0,"label":"fibrils (5 mg/mL)","unit":1}},"2":{"type":"temperature","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"error_temperature":false,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"temperature":"-80","unit":10}},"3":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"eberh","text":"A proper lab coat, gloves, sleeve guards, and an N95 or FFP2 mask should be worn while working with PFFs to prevent inhalation or exposure. PFF-contaminated items, such as pipette tips, tubes, gloves, and any spills, should be decontaminated with 1% SDS before disposal.","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"8lrr7","text":"Fill Qsonica Sonicator (Q700 Sonicator) water reservoir with about   deionized water.  ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":67,"length":1}],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"amount","mutability":"","data":{"amount":"900","error":false,"guid":"137B1110AF2311EAA85E013497DF7FCF","id":0,"label":"","unit":2}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"4lrp","text":"Turn on the heating system of the Q700 Sonicator and set the temperature at  .","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":76,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"7gk71","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"temperature","mutability":"","data":{"error_temperature":false,"guid":"1F5239A0AF2311EAA85E013497DF7FCF","id":0,"label":"","temperature":"10","unit":10}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"8eo4g","text":"Fit the polystyrene sonication tube containing PFFs to the Q700 Sonicator tube holder and transfer it into the Q700 Sonicator water reservoir. Ensure the reservoir water level is maintained up to the level of the upper meniscus of the PFFs (PFFs: green in the figure below). Operate the sonication for    at an amplitude of 45%, with pulse on and off durations of   and   respectively, which should generate a power of around 110 watts for each pulse.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":303,"length":1},{"key":1,"offset":364,"length":1},{"key":2,"offset":370,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"97aqg","text":" ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"f4bnj","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"4eebf","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":3,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"8co24","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"duration","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"duration":900,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","pause":null,"preset":[],"start":null}},"1":{"type":"duration","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"duration":3,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","pause":null,"preset":[],"start":null}},"2":{"type":"duration","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"duration":3,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","pause":null,"preset":[],"start":null}},"3":{"type":"image","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"guid":"D3BA2A1B344211EFA81B0A58A9FEAC02","height":222,"id":479438,"is_video":false,"legend":"{\"blocks\":null,\"entityMap\":null}","mime":"image/png","nestedSelector":null,"original_name":"Screenshot 2020-06-16 at 19.00.14.png","placeholder":"https://content.protocols.io/files/qwcnb73rx.png","shadow":false,"source":"https://content.protocols.io/files/qwgqb73rx.jpg","webp_source":"https://content.protocols.io/files/qwgpb73rx.webp","width":550}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"5kcus","text":"Take the sample tube after sonication and wipe it to remove any water from the reservoir. Spin the tube at   for a few seconds to settle PFF droplets inside. Inside the biosafety hood, remix the PFF sample by pipetting up and down 5 times, ensuring to avoid introducing bubbles. After remixing, re-sonicate the sample for    using the same sonication parameters as described above in step 4.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":107,"length":1},{"key":1,"offset":322,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"3fap8","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":2,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"b76eb","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"unmr","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"centrifuge","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"centrifuge":"1000","duration":0,"error_centrifuge":false,"error_temperature":false,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","pause":null,"preset":[],"scientificNotation":{"centrifuge":false,"temperature":false},"start":null,"temperature":"","temperatureUnit":-1,"unit":33}},"1":{"type":"duration","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"duration":450,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","pause":null,"preset":[],"start":null}},"2":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"length":1,"offset":131},{"key":1,"length":1,"offset":241}],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"1lr1o","text":"We also receive a bulk of sonicated PFFs aliquoted at a volume of 22-25 µl, with an optimal size of around 50 nm. We store them at   for months, and on the day of injection, we re-sonicate using the above-mentioned sonication parameters for  .","type":"unstyled"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"1454u","text":"","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{"0":{"data":{"error_temperature":false,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"temperature":"-80","unit":10},"mutability":"MUTABLE","type":"temperature"},"1":{"data":{"duration":900,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","pause":null,"preset":[],"start":null},"mutability":"MUTABLE","type":"duration"}}}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"2n96t","text":"Inject the sonicated PFFs in the mouse brain as soon as possible within   . PFFs should be kept at room temperature until all mice are injected. The monomer, serving as a control, should be spun down at   at   for   to obtain supernatant for injection and then kept on ice until all mice are injected. Any leftover PFFs should be properly disposed of after SDS treatment as indicated earlier.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":72,"length":1},{"key":1,"offset":203,"length":1},{"key":2,"offset":208,"length":1},{"key":3,"offset":214,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"biqe3","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9fbr5","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":4,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"6f2n4","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1o4rl","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"duration","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"duration":28800,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","pause":null,"preset":[],"start":null}},"1":{"type":"temperature","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"error_temperature":false,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"temperature":"","unit":10}},"2":{"type":"centrifuge","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"centrifuge":"20000","duration":0,"error_centrifuge":false,"error_temperature":false,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","pause":null,"preset":[],"scientificNotation":{"centrifuge":false,"temperature":false},"start":null,"temperature":"","temperatureUnit":10,"unit":34}},"3":{"type":"duration","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"duration":900,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","pause":null,"preset":[],"start":null}},"4":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"eu6ib","text":"We transfer 1 µl of sonicated PFFs into an Eppendorf tube before the first injection and another 1 µl after the last injection into another Eppendorf tube. Both samples are diluted in 1X PBS (to a final volume of 500 µl), snap-frozen on dry ice if a dynamic light scattering detector is not immediately available, and then sent for dynamic light scattering analysis to check if the PFFs are fragmented to the optimal fibril sizes of around 50 nm after sonication, and to ensure that this size is maintained during the injection sessions. Larger sizes indicate that the injected PFFs may not develop the extent of pathology seen with fibrils of optimal size.","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}
